meanings.definition: Not capable of living or developing successfully
meanings.sent1: The inviable plant could not grow in the harsh desert conditions.
meanings.sent2: The inviable eggs of the bird were unable to hatch.
meanings.sent3: The inviable seed stubbornly refused to sprout, much to the gardener's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The inviable business idea quickly withered away in the competitive market.
meanings.sent5: The inviable dream of flying without wings seemed impossible to achieve.

meanings.definition: Not able to survive or thrive
meanings.sent1: The inviable fish struggled to swim in the polluted waters.
meanings.sent2: The inviable species faced extinction due to habitat loss.
meanings.sent3: The inviable plan to stay up all night studying backfired when the student fell asleep in class.
meanings.sent4: The inviable relationship slowly faded away despite efforts to save it.
meanings.sent5: The inviable hope of finding water in the desert left the traveler feeling desperate.
